page.title: 03FIFE NESS COASTGUARD STATION
page.content: The Fife Ness Coastguard Sation is situated approximately three miles from the town of Crail. The Coast- guard station was built in l975. Employed at the coastguard station are five coastguards and five auxiliary workers. The coastguards have to train for nine months. They learn all about cliff rescue equipment, must know all about ships and communications. In the coastguard station itself, it is equipped with very up-to-date equipment such as the Telex Machine,a machine which transmits pictures on to paper and computers. There is a lighthouse about l00 yards from the coastguard station and this replaced the North Carr Lightship. The Fife Ness Coastguard Station is also a weather station.
